title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Niccolò Salvini. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: How to calculate indicators with `coresoi`
text: Let’s say interested calculating indicator say number 11, namely Distance award value sums paid. indicator aims quantifying difference sum foreseen contract actual payment C.. (ita S.. Stazione Appaltante) prior emergency outbreak. extremely convenient since may expect ratio ’s paid actually paid (words proportion contract value left paid) needs remain just equal two adjacent periods. may also suppose happen due fact emergency outbreaks inspections controls wicker less -depth. may give chance fraudsters get money quicker runaway 💰. indicator quantify type risk. need load data mock_data_core supply related variables function ind_11(). Check documentation function ind_11() get grasp . output ind_11 schema shows … … may want also interested … … ggplot2 graphs minimal model…
code: data("mock_data_core", package = "coresoi")  ind_11(   data = mock_data_core,   award_value=importo_aggiudicazione,    sums_paid=importo_lotto,   cf_amministrazione_appaltante,   publication_date=data_pubblicazione,   emergency_name = "coronavirus"   ) |>   head(10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 12 #> # Groups:   aggregation_name [7] #>    indicator_id indica…¹ aggre…² indic…³ aggre…⁴ aggre…⁵ emerg…⁶ emerg…⁷ count…⁸ #>           <dbl> <chr>    <chr>     <dbl> <chr>   <chr>     <int> <chr>   <chr>   #>  1           11 Distanc… 000080…    1.50 ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #>  2           11 Distanc… 000331…    1.32 ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #>  3           11 Distanc… 000346…    1    ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #>  4           11 Distanc… 000351…    1.13 ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #>  5           11 Distanc… 000351…   26.6  ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #>  6           11 Distanc… 000405…    1.36 ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #>  7           11 Distanc… 000407…    1.15 ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #>  8           11 Distanc… 000407…    1    ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #>  9           11 Distanc… 000416…    1.25 ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #> 10           11 Distanc… 000416…    1.17 ISTAT1  cf_amm…       1 Corona… 1       #> # … with 3 more variables: country_name <chr>, indicator_last_update <dttm>, #> #   data_last_update <dttm>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​indicator_name, #> #   ²​aggregation_name, ³​indicator_value, ⁴​aggregation_id, ⁵​aggregation_type, #> #   ⁶​emergency_id, ⁷​emergency_name, ⁸​country_id

title: Performing a request to CORE API via R
text: Since CORE API hood uses package might interested see behaves called via R. work APIs R, need bring libraries. libraries take complexities API request wrap functions can use single lines code. R library ’ll using httr2. downloading libraries, ’ll able use R scripts RMarkdown files. Use req_perform() perform request, retrieving response:
code: library(httr2) core_api_url = "" req <- request("https://r-project.org") req resp <- req_perform(req) resp

title: Measuring Corruption Risk in Emergency

text: can install development version coresoi GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("CORE-forge/coresoi")

what: Example: Compute indicator High Winning Rate
title: Measuring Corruption Risk in Emergency
text: might case compute indicator n° 1, mainly accounts companies Emergency outbreak (case Coronavirus) awarded public contracts much frequently Emergency. Indicator 11 computes Fish exact’s test proportion pre post emergency, poiting statistical significance two group proportions. resulting indicator follows schema generated coresoi::generate_indicator_schema. Let’s now visualize results top 10 provinces given High Winning Rate indicator estimate.
code: library(coresoi) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  ## basic example code with ind_1() i.e. High Winning Rate ind_1_res <- ind_1(   data = mock_data_core,    publication_date = data_pubblicazione,    cpv = cod_cpv,    stat_unit = provincia,   emergency_name = "coronavirus") ind_1_res #> # A tibble: 108 × 12 #> # Rowwise:  #>    indicator_id indica…¹ indic…² aggre…³ aggre…⁴ aggre…⁵ emerg…⁶ emerg…⁷ count…⁸ #>           <dbl> <chr>      <dbl> <fct>   <chr>   <chr>     <int> <chr>   <chr>   #>  1            1 High wi…   0.198 AGRIGE… ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #>  2            1 High wi…   0.002 ALESSA… ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #>  3            1 High wi…   0.552 ANCONA  ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #>  4            1 High wi…   1     AREZZO  ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #>  5            1 High wi…   1     ASCOLI… ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #>  6            1 High wi…   0.004 ASTI    ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #>  7            1 High wi…   0.192 AVELLI… ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #>  8            1 High wi…   0.145 BARI    ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #>  9            1 High wi…   0.136 BARLET… ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #> 10            1 High wi…   0.007 BELLUNO ISTAT1  provin…       1 Corona… 1       #> # … with 98 more rows, 3 more variables: country_name <chr>, #> #   indicator_last_update <dttm>, data_last_update <dttm>, and abbreviated #> #   variable names ¹​indicator_name, ²​indicator_value, ³​aggregation_name, #> #   ⁴​aggregation_id, ⁵​aggregation_type, ⁶​emergency_id, ⁷​emergency_name, #> #   ⁸​country_id library(ggplot2) library(forcats) library(tidyr) drop_na(ind_1_res) %>%    ggplot(aes(y = fct_reorder(aggregation_name, indicator_value), x = indicator_value)) +   geom_col() +   scale_y_discrete(guide = guide_axis(check.overlap = TRUE)) +   labs(     y = "",     x = "Fisher' Exact test pvalue (indicator 1)"   )

title: Measuring Corruption Risk in Emergency
text: coresoi part project CO.R.E.- Corruption risk indicators emergency, financed EU Commission, part Internal Police Security Fund (ISF-P) program, project presented Department Political Sciences leader coordination Prof. Gnaldi (PI) funded total 514 thousand euros. working group made colleagues Prof. Enrico Carloni, Prof. Marco Mazzoni, Prof. Benedetto Ponti, Prof. Maria Giovanna Ranalli. international network involves Universitat Obierta Catalunya (Spain), Dublin City University (Ireland), Oficina Antifrau de Catalunya (Spain), Infonodes (Italy), Transparency International (Portugal), Villa Montesca Foundation (Italy). C.R.E. focuses assessing risk corruption public procurement preventive perspective. view achieving goal, central European agenda, CO.R.E. therefore intends develop validate procedure constructing synthetic indicator risk corruption emergency period can usefully used national anti-corruption agencies, media citizens accountability purposes.

title: Compute indicator High Winning Rate — ind_1
text: data bndcp data publication_date date tender published cpv Common Procurement Vocabulary. main vocabulary based tree structure made codes 9 digits (8 digit code plus check digit). combination digits associated wording describes type supplies, works services defining subject contract emergency_name emergency name character string want evaluate indicator, e.g. "Coronavirus" "Terremoto Aquila" stat_unit statistical unit measurement, aggregation variable, indicator target divison first two digits cpv code identifying division, info check https://simap.ted.europa.eu//cpv

title: Compute indicator High Winning Rate — ind_1
text: indicator schema generate_indicator_schema

title: Compute indicator High Winning Rate — ind_1
code: if (FALSE) { if (interactive()) {   data("test_data_bndcp_core")   ind_1(     data = mock_data_core,     publication_date = data_pubblicazione,     cpv = cod_cpv,     stat_unit = provincia,     emergency_name = "coronavirus"   ) } }
